abstract: Federal Deposit Insurance Corp reports earnings at United States banks dropped 7.3 percent in fourth quarter from year-earlier period; decline reflects increased legal costs at handful of large institutions as well as reduced income from mortgage business.
lead_paragraph: Three of the biggest United States banks — JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America and Citigroup — together posted $4.4 billion in legal costs during the quarter.

headline.main: Legal Costs Weigh Down U.S. Banks’ Earnings
headline.print_headline: Legal Costs Weigh Down U.S. Banks’ Earnings

snippet: Three of the biggest United States banks — JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America and Citigroup — together posted $4.4 billion in legal costs during the quarter.
